attributes.action: Introduce legistation, making any forms of breaching Net Neutrality by telecomms and internet service providers illegal.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Virgin Media Inc (abbreviated to VM), has recently followed suit of the major American ISP's (Internet Service Providers), by stating its belief that keeping the Internet free and open is not compatible with their thirst for profit, and that they are currently discussing deals with companies and corporations to create two tiers of Internet access for their customers.
Companies that pay up will have access to their sites as usual, those who do not pay, will have lesser provisions of bandwidth.
If VM managed to successfully implement their plan, without a major consumer boycott; other ISP's will do the same, most have kept silent on plans to do so, mostly for fear of consumer action.
Potentially this could lead to devastating effects on the internet as we know it today.
A company could pay ISP's to block or minimise bandwidth to competitors and smaller websites, making them practically unusable for the ISP's customers.
Without serious intervention, in legislation or consumer action, the Internet may become a place where only wealthy companies and corporations may host websites.
